result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason R. Powell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason R. Powell in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CF95 & 14CF158  @  9:36 am.  Jury is still present in large courtroom, 14CF95, plea to ct. 1, 6 months jail, fine 3445, 30 months revocation, 30 months IID, alcohol assessment, Ct 2 dismissed but consolidate BAC. .23.  14CF158 Plea to ct's 1 2 3 & 4.  Ct 1 Defer Judgment for 2 year with condition in agreement, ct's 2 3 & 4 withheld sentence 2 years probation, 60 days jail consecutive 14CF95, 16CF38 DRI which is set w/Judge Rhode, 14CF95  Ct 5, DRI. Atty Roley and defendant agree with plea agreement, 14CF95 ct 2 Dismissed, Ct 1 Guilty plea, 14CF158  Ct 5 Dismissed, ct 1 no contest plea, ct 2 no contest plea, ct 3 no contest plea, ct 4 no contest.  16CF38 Judge has authority to handle case,  no objections by parties, DRI.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & JT. Def. understands elements.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.  Atty Roley is satisfied and factual basis. Def. agrees prior convictions. State gives convictions of OWI.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given, factual basis & finds def. Guilty to CT 1 OWI 4th w/5 years, in 14CF95, Ct 1 Strangulation, Ct 2 Battery, Domestic, Ct 3 Bailjumping,  Ct 4 DC, Domestic Ct 1 Defer judgment on and finds def. Guilty on ct's 2, 3, 4. State gives sentencing recommendation. Victim rights complied with.  Victim in courtroom on 16CF158.  Court excuse jury @ 9:56 am.  State gives defendant criminal history.  Atty Roley gives sentencing recommendation. Def. makes statement.  M.K. makes statement. Court accepts joint recommendation

14CF95 ct 1 6 months jail, huber privileges, good time applied, Fine totaling 3444, 30 months revocation, 30 months IID, upon application and any vehicle titled is his name, and alcohol assessment

14CF158 Ct 1 Court signs order, Ct 2, 3 & 4 withheld sentence 2 years probation, concurrent to 14CF95,  60 days jail consecutive to 14CF95, no good time, huber privileges, Court authority community service 973.03(3), Anger Management,  no use or consume alcohol,  no present in taverns, Def. must attend program AA NA or community treatment program,  100 hours of  community service within 1st year of probation,   Maintain full time employment of 35 hours week,  if not employed must apply for 5 jobs a week and must give agent report on month bases job search activity, jail commence today, costs, 
16CF38 Bond to be returned to poster.  
14CF158 Court orders $774.00 and will be taken from bond and balance to be applied to costs and Jail sentence in 14CF158  on ct 4 only,.
State heard on DNA surcharge, Court orders DNA surcharge on each ct's. 14CF95 200 a month on p.p. if late Court will order 6 months jail. DNA Sample.  Def. advised of firearm rights. AODA and follow through with recommendations on 14CF158. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Court adjourns.  Atty Roley questions community service, if can't start community service while in jail, than community service will commence when released from jail.  Def. questions IID. If def. needs exemption, Court will allow Judge Rhode to sign exemption if will, if not fax to Judge Stenz.
Court recalls at 10:41 am. 
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Jason R. Powell in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:04 p.m.  Scheduled for plea/sentencing however, requesting adjournment. Court will allow. New date to be determined at status conf. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on May 16, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Jason R. Powell in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:18 a.m. Copy of information was received, reading waived. Not guilty pleas to all counts. Court receives pleas and directs entry in record. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No use of alcohol. No contact with M. K.

Defendant Jason R. Powell in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:33 pm.  State is ready to proceed.  Officer Ryan Bula, City of Antigo Police Dept., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Exh. #1 Bail/Bond in 14CF95 Exh. #2 Bail/Bond in 14CF158. State offers Exh. #1 & 2, Court receives. State rest. Atty Roley gives argument.  State gives argument. Court finds proable cause and binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Roley has copy of information. Bond remains. Atty Roley heard on bond. State heard on bond. Court will reduce bond to $1,000.00 cash, already posted w/same conditions. Refund to be returned to poster.  Arraignment scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.
